Article Title: Retired professional falls victim to deepfake scam featuring Mukesh Ambani
Article Text:
Representative Image

MUMBAI: A retired hotel management professional from Andheri (West) fell victim to a sophisticated online scam when he was enticed into investing Rs62,500 after encountering a deepfake video on YouTube featuring Mukesh Ambani endorsing a stock market forum and providing investment advice . Amboli police registered the case based on the complaint filed by PS Jerome (77) on July 9 after he discovered that he was deceived when he stumbled upon the clip on June 14, created using advanced artificial voice cloning technology, which showcases Ambani promoting the forum.This marks the third such incident that has emerged since March, where fraudsters have exploited the chairman and managing director of Reliance Industries' deepfake clip to lure unsuspecting individuals into investing in the stock market, resulting in financial losses for the victims."The cyber team is tracking the internet protocol (IP) address and the origin of the clip from where it was uploaded to apprehend the perpetrators. We have requested details of the Moradabad bank account to which the fraudster coerced Jerome to transfer the funds," said a police officer from the Amboli police station.Jerome was swindled between June 15 and 18 when he made two fund transfers of Rs12500 and Rs50000 from the savings he had accumulated from the interest he received from his retirement fund. He sensed something was amiss when the fraudster persistently pressured him to invest more money. In the complaint, Jerome said: "I decided to invest after viewing a YouTube video featuring Ambani and Neil Keni endorsing 'Forex Quantum Capital.' I contacted a number that was displayed in the video. Subsequently, I began receiving incessant calls urging me to invest."Jerome grew suspicious when the caller started aggressively pushing him to invest more. "Jerome demanded a refund of his investment. The fraudster refused to refund the money and instead insisted that Jerome invest more to recover his initial investment. In an attempt to gain trust, the fraudster sent a passport copy claiming to be an employee of the stock market firm and provided details about the company. However, Jerome remained unconvinced and persisted in demanding the return of his money. His suspicions were confirmed when the caller adamantly refused to refund his investment," explained a police officer.In June, a 54-year-old Ayurveda doctor from Andheri (West) also fell prey to a similar share trading scam and lost Rs 7.09 lakhs. The scam involved an Instagram reel featuring a video clip of Mukesh Ambani praising a company called "Rajiv Sharma Trade Group" and encouraging viewers to join its BCF Investment Academy for high returns. The Oshiwara police registered an FIR against an unknown person. Dr KKH Patil was duped between May 28 and June 10 when she transferred Rs 7.09 lakhs on 16 occasions to different bank accounts after being persuaded to invest for substantial returns.
Article Summary: A retired hotel management professional from Andheri (West) fell victim to a sophisticated online scam. He was enticed into investing Rs62,500 after encountering a deepfake video on YouTube featuring Mukesh Ambani endorsing a stock market forum. Amboli police registered the case based on the complaint filed by PS Jerome.

Article Title: Mission Olympic Cell clears proposals of Paris-bound athletes for equipment
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The Sports Ministry 's Mission Olympic Cell (MOC) on Thursday approved several proposals to provide equipment assistance to athletes and para-athletes in preparation for the Paris Olympics and Paralympic Games .The approval took place during the MOC's weekly meeting.The MOC sanctioned paralympic table tennis medallist Bhavina Patel's request to participate in the ITTF Para Table Tennis Asia Training Camp 2024 in Thailand from July 16 to 20, along with her coach and escort.Additionally, para shooters Manish Narwal, Rudranksh Khandelwal, Rubina Francis, and Sriharsha R Devareddy received approval for various sport-shooting equipment. This includes an air rifle for Sriharsha and a Morini pistol for Rubina.Para-athlete Sandeep Choudhary's request for assistance in procuring two javelins—Valhalla 800g Medium NXB and Diana Carbon 600g—was also approved.Archers Ankita Bhakat and Deepika Kumari, along with para-archers Sheetal Devi and Rakesh Kumar, will receive financial assistance for equipment procurement.Judoka Tulika Maan, along with her coach, received approval to train in the Valencia Judo High Performance Centre in Spain until July 25.Table tennis player Manush Shah’s request for financial assistance for training in Gyeonggi Do, South Korea, under Taejun Kim and for physical fitness equipment was also granted.In a significant development, the MOC also approved the inclusion of athletes Suraj Panwar, Vikash Singh, Ankita Dhyani, and swimmer Dhinidhi Desinghu into the Target Olympic Podium Scheme (TOPS) Core group.Additionally, athletes Jeswin Aldrin, Praveen Chithravel, Akashdeep Singh, and Paramjeet Singh were promoted from the TOPS Development group to the Core Group.
Article Summary: The Sports Ministry's Mission Olympic Cell (MOC) on Thursday approved several proposals to provide equipment assistance to athletes and para-athletes. The approval took place during the MOC's weekly meeting. Para shooters Manish Narwal, Rudranksh Khandelwal, Rubina Francis, and Sriharsha R Devareddy received approval.

Article Title: Musk: Elon Musk says Twitter in precarious position, defends cost cuts
Article Text: SAN FRANCISCO: Elon Musk is defending his massive cost-cutting at Twitter as necessary for the social media platform to survive next year, due in part to debt payments tied to his $44 billion takeover of the company."This company is like, basically, you're in a plane that is headed towards the ground at high speed with the engines on fire and the controls don't work," Musk told a late-night audience on a Twitter Spaces call Tuesday.That's after Elon Musk said earlier on Tuesday that he plans on remaining as Twitter's CEO until he can find someone willing to replace him in the job.Musk's announcement came after millions of Twitter users asked him to step down in an online poll the billionaire himself created and promised to abide by."I will resign as CEO as soon as I find someone foolish enough to take the job!" Musk tweeted. "After that, I will just run the software & servers teams."Since taking over the San Francisco social media platform in late October, Musk's run as CEO has been marked by quickly issued rules and policies that have often been withdrawn or changed soon after being made public.Musk said Tuesday night that he "spent the last five weeks cutting costs like crazy" and trying to build a stronger paid subscription service because otherwise Twitter might be operating with $3 billion in negative cash flow next year. He in part blamed the $12.5 billion in debt tied to his April agreement to buy the company, as well as the Federal Reserve's recent interest rate hikes.Some of Musk's actions have unnerved Twitter advertisers and turned off users. He has laid off more than half of Twitter's workforce, released contract content moderators and disbanded a council of trust and safety advisors that the company formed in 2016 to address hate speech and other problems on the platform.The Tesla CEO has also alienated investors at his electric vehicle company over concerns that Twitter is taking too much of his attention, and possibly offending loyal customers.Even more unnerving for investors, Tesla shares are plummeting.Shares of Tesla are down 35% since Musk took over Twitter on Oct. 27, costing investors billions. Tesla's market value was over $1.1 trillion on April 1, the last trading day before Musk disclosed he was buying up Twitter shares. The company has since lost 58% of its value, at a time when rival auto makers are cutting in on Tesla's dominant share of electric vehicle sales.Shares fell Wednesday, as they have every day this week.A single share of Tesla that cost about $400 to start the year, can now be had for less than $140.Musk sought to defend some of his recent Twitter decisions on the Twitter Spaces call."They may seem sometimes spurious or odd or whatever," Musk said. "It's because we have an emergency fire drill on our hands. That's the reason. Not because I'm naturally capricious. Or at least, aspirationally, I'm not naturally capricious."Musk, who also helms the SpaceX rocket company, has previously acknowledged how difficult it will be to find someone to take over as Twitter CEO .Bantering with Twitter followers earlier this week, he said that the person replacing him "must like pain a lot" to run a company that he said has been "in the fast lane to bankruptcy.""No one wants the job who can actually keep Twitter alive. There is no successor," Musk tweeted.As things stand, Musk would still retain overwhelming influence over platform as its owner. He fired the company's board of directors soon after taking control.
Article Summary: Elon Musk says he plans on remaining as Twitter's CEO until he can find someone willing to replace him in the job. Musk's run as CEO has been marked by quickly issued rules and policies that have often been withdrawn or changed soon after being made public. Musk has laid off more than half of Twitter's workforce.
